cip.render.util3d

Class Plane3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.util3d.Plane3f

  • public final class Plane3f
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a plane in 3D of single precision (the components are represented by float values), hence the name Plane3f.

    The plane is implicitly represented by the formula: Ai + Bj + Ck + D = distance. Where distance is the perpendicular distance of the point i,j,k from the plane if the plane is normalized, and the normal of the plane is A,B,C. A point is on the plane when distance = 0.

    This class implements the basic functionality for a 3D plane required for rendering and 3D graphics use. This class is patterned after and most code adapted from the CPlane3f class of the JOEY toolkit written and distributed by Crisis in Perspective, Inc.

    Since:
    1.0

      • Plane3f

        public Plane3f(Vector3f normal,
               Point3f pt)
        Instantiates an initialized instance of Plane3f.
        Parameters:
        normal - The normal of the plane. NOTE: the normal is not re-normalized as part of the initialization. If there is any question about whether the normal is a unit vector, then the plane should be normalized after instantiation.
        pt - A point on the plane

      • setValue

        public Plane3f setValue(Vector3f normal,
                        Point3f pt)
        Sets the coefficients of the plane equation for a plane that has the specified normal and passes through the specified point.
        Parameters:
        normal - The normal of the plane. NOTE: the normal is not re-normalized as part of the initialization. If there is any question about whether the normal is a unit vector, then the plane should be normalized after instantiation.
        pt - A point on the plane
        Returns:
        Returns this plane after the coefficients of the plane equation have been set.

      • normalize

        public Plane3f normalize()
                  throws ZeroLengthVectorException
        Normalizes the plane equation coefficients so that the normal, A,B,C, is a unit vector.
        Returns:
        Returns this plane after normalization.
        Throws:
        ZeroLengthVectorException - If the current length of the normal is so close to zero that a meaningful normal cannot be generated.

      • getNormal

        public Vector3f getNormal(Vector3f normal)
        Gets the normal of the vector,A,B,C. The normal will be a unit vector only if the plane is normalized.
        Parameters:
        normal - The vector to be set to the normal.
        Returns:
        The vector normal is returned.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Plane3f pln)
        Tests another plane, pln, for equality with this plane.
        Parameters:
        pln - The plane to be tested. This plane is unchanged.
        Returns:
        Returns true if pln is equal to this plane (identical in all coefficients), and false otherwise. NOTE: it is possible that the planes represent the same physical plane but have unequal coefficients if one or both are not normalized.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Tests another object, obj, for equality with this plane.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested. This object is unchanged.
        Returns:
        Returns true if obj is both a Plane3f and is equal to this plane (identical in all coefficients), and false otherwise. NOTE: it is possible that the planes represent the same physical plane but have unequal coefficients if one or both are not normalized.

      • getIntersection

        public Plane3fIntersection getIntersection(Plane3fIntersection plnInt,
                                           Point3f pt,
                                           Vector3f v)
        Get the intersection of a ray starting at point pt in the direction v with this plane. The plane and the ray direction should be normalized for the correct intersection distance to be reported.
        Parameters:
        plnInt - The intersection.
        pt - The origin of the ray.
        v - The direction of the ray.
        Returns:
        Returns the intersection, plnInt.

      • getIntersection

        public Plane3fIntersection getIntersection(Plane3fIntersection plnInt,
                                           Line3f ray)
        Get the intersection of a ray, ray, with this plane. The plane and the ray should be normalized for the correct intersection distance to be reported.
        Parameters:
        plnInt - The intersection instance to be populated with the intersection.
        ray - The ray.
        Returns:
        Returns the intersection, plnInt.
